FIG. 2. Transformations from KC to $D$ –SC corresponding to Fig. 1(c). (A) KC to $D$ –SC I via ‘longitudinal’ constriction of GBs. (a)– D D(f) Snapshots of MD configurations at different temperatures. Thermal noises are eliminated from MD configurations via energy minimizations (indicated by $Q$ as “quenched” state). Frames of initial Kelvin cells are drawn in (b), (d) and (f) to reveal the structural Qevolution, where atoms in fcc lattice sites colored in blue in (a), (c) and (e) are removed. (B) KC to –SC II via ‘transverse’ constriction Dof GBs. (g)–(l) Quenched states of MD configurations at different temperatures. To reveal GB activities, the [111] foils $( \sim 1 . 5 \ \mathrm { n m }$ thick) are shown in (h), (j) and (i). FIG. 4. (a) Size dependence of $D$ -SC thermostability, $T _ { S } / T _ { E }$ vs $D _ { S }$ D TS=TE. The temperature range of KC–to–SC transformation is DSmarked by the dashed line and error bars. Here, S0, S1, S2, S3, and S4 stand for D-SC structures obtained upon transformations from KCs of various supercell sizes, i.e., $a \cong$ 13 nm (KC0), $6 . 5 \ \mathrm { n m }$ a (KC1), 5.7 nm (KC2), 4.3 nm (KC3), and 3.3 nm (KC4), see additional details in the Supplemental Material [3]. (b) MD snapshot of a –SC I at 473 K, containing 8 $( 2 \times 2 \times 2 )$ unit cells of $a \sim 6 . 5 ~ \mathrm { n m }$ and $D _ { S } \sim 4 . 6 ~ \mathrm { n m }$ .
